page.title: 13Animals in S.Clevedon & Kenn
page.content: {Rabbits}are one of the most common wild animals in the landscape. They are grey-brown in colour with white under fur and a fluffy white tail. They feed on grass and other vegetation.{Magpies}can be seen jumping on the backs of sheep. They belong to the {crow family.}They have glossy black and white plumage and a long tail. They are notorious thieves. Herons are often to be found around here. They are large wading{birds}with long legs & straight bills. They fly very slowly because of their large wings. The plumage is ash-gray with darker grey flight feathers and a white forehead and neck.
